intro: Calycophysum pedunculatum, commonly known as the clustered bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves and specialized structures called bladders, which are used for capturing small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually appearing in clusters at the base of the stems. Calycophysum pedunculatum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
